function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Assessing room acoustic performance in an unoccupied room with HVAC running and closed windows may not accurately reflect real-life conditions for disease propagation.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment may lead to ineffective disease control measures and increased risk of disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Conduct acoustic performance assessment in occupied rooms with varying HVAC and window conditions to capture real-life scenarios.","Technologies":"Smart sensors for real-time monitoring, integration of acoustic data with disease transmission models.","People":"Building occupants, public health officials, facility managers.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, public health officials."},{"Description":"Lack of immediate control means or technologies for acoustic environment in most buildings.","Impact":"Inability to promptly address poor acoustic environments that may facilitate disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Invest in building design and materials that prioritize acoustic performance, implement sound-absorbing structures and materials.","Technologies":"Sound-absorbing materials, acoustic design software, smart building management systems.","People":"Architects, building designers, facility managers, building owners.","Owner":"Architects, building designers, facility managers, building owners."},{"Description":"Continuous monitoring of noise levels may be less valuable in comparison with other indoor environmental quality (IEQ) parameters.","Impact":"Potential neglect of acoustic environment in favor of other IEQ parameters, leading to suboptimal building conditions for disease control.","Mitigation":"Integrated monitoring systems to capture data on multiple IEQ parameters including acoustic environment, prioritize research on the impact of acoustic environment on disease transmission.","Technologies":"Integrated sensor systems, acoustic monitoring devices, data analytics for IEQ parameters.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, building owners, facility managers.","Owner":"Researchers, public health officials, building owners, facility managers."}]}
